arts.ttl: Juventus boss Thiago Motta defends substitutes decision after Champions League exit
arts.sum: Serie A giants Juventus were knocked out of the UEFA Champions League at the hands of PSV Eindhoven yesterday and they followed the footsteps of both Milan and Atalanta. PSV…

arts.ttl: Thiago Motta Delivers Honest Verdict on Juventus Champions League Exit
arts.sum: Juventus failed to progress from a Champions League knockout playoff tie for the first time after 20 consecutive triumphs. Indeed, PSV Eindhoven overturned a 2-1 first-leg deficit with a 3-1 extra-time win at the Philips Stadion last night. The post Thiago Motta Delivers Honest Verdict on Juventus Champions League Exit appeared first on The Cult of Calcio.

arts.ttl: How 'dangerous' Lang helped PSV beat Juventus
arts.sum: Stephen Warnock praises the "balance" and "end product" of PSV Eindhoven's Noa Lang after the Dutch winger's impressive performance in PSV's 3-1 (4-3 on aggregate) win over Juventus in the Champions League Play-offs.

arts.ttl: Champions League roundup: PSV’s Ryan Flamingo dumps out Juventus
arts.sum: PSV beat Juventus 3-1 after extra time in playoff PSG and Borussia Dortmund stroll into last 16 Ryan Flamingo scored in extra time to give PSV Eindhoven a 3-1 home win on Wednesday in the second leg of their Champions League knockout phase playoff against Juventus, overturning a first-leg deficit and putting them into the last 16. The tie was level at 3-3 on aggregate after 90 minutes and went into extra time before Flamingo poached a 98th-minute winner as Juventus became the third Italian side eliminated from the competition, after Milan and Atalanta on Tuesday. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Juventus exit in extra time at PSV completes sorry hat trick for Italy in Champions League playoffs
arts.sum: Only Inter Milan — the last Serie A team to be European champion 15 years ago — will represent Italy in the round of 16 draw Friday. Two-time European champion Juventus lost 3-1 after extra time at PSV Eindhoven, which advanced to the round of 16 on a 4-3 aggregate score.

arts.ttl: PSV net extra-time winner to knock out Juventus
arts.sum: PSV's Ryan Flamingo scores an extra-time winner against Juventus to overturn their first-leg deficit and secure a place in the last 16 of the Champions League.

arts.ttl: Locatelli: PSV ‘wanted it more’ than Juventus
